Reviews.Title: “Boutique style”
Reviews.Author: ErlendWD
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and cozy. French charm. Rooms were quite small, but very nicely decorated. Location was great, and staff was very helpful. There was a hiccup with the breakfast on our last day, but they refunded and compensated our expenses for eating elsewhere, so it was all dealt with in a professional way. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, nice place, very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Marc-PhilippeG
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 4 nights for business - Very parisian style hotel for the decoration - old, nice building, but double-glazing for the windows, hence quite peaceful inside. The staff is very friendly, the experience was enjoyable from check-in till check-out. Rooms are really very, very small, that's a big shortfall - I had to upgrade with additionnal EUR 65 per night to get 45 sqm, the first room I was assigned (Deluxe) was really ridiculously small, but bed and linen are excellent. Bathroom not completely clean, bit of moisture here and there, would need an overhaul, but clean otherwise, besides of that. No fitness, no nothing besides of the room, but a very cozzy and warm lobby, really nice. At breakfast, pastries were cold and not really good, something to be improved, and not much choice in the menu. On the other hand, room service was very good, and generous. In short: the hotel is worth for the quality of the staff, very helpful and friendly, but rooms are very small, and quality of food should be improved. I would stay there again since our parisian office is just a few hundreds meters from the hotel, but for the price, I would suggest to look for another place offering larger rooms. It's a bit rough to pay 350 EUR for 40 sqm in Paris, even in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: EDM1953
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in February. The staff were amazing, they couldn't do enough for us, especially the Concierge. We commented to the reception staff that we would not go up the Eiffel Tower because of the long queues. A few minutes later the concierge arrives at our room offering to see what he can do. 10 minutes later tickets booked and paid for. The room was very comfortable, beautiful bedding. We asked if we could leave our luggage at reception as we were not getting the Eurostar until evening. Just before checkout reception rang and offered us a free extended checkout as they were not full that night. The only thing I could find wrong is that the lower two flights of stairs are a little threadbare on the edge of the tread.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel with excellent Front Office Staff”
Reviews.Author: MINIPolka
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed in this chic hotel for two nights in February. Radisson Blu Le Dokhan's Hotel is a charming, small hotel located in the west side of Paris in the Trocadero district which is really a stone's throw from the Eiffel Tower and other touristic spots. The interiors are very stylish and the rooms are beautifully decorated throughout. Our room was an ok size but the size of toilet was shocking. Nevertheless this would not put me off from staying there again. Definitely the biggest plus of the hotel is its staff. Everyone was so friendly and helpful they really make you feel at home. Special thanks to Louise from the Front Office; she answered every question we had, with a smile, and a real friendly & proffessional approach. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian chic, fantastic staff. Great choice.”
Reviews.Author: traindriver240
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights as a valentine special for the wife and despite initial doubts it grew on us and we ended up loving it. The hotel is one of several in a residential area but still within 5-10 minutes walk of the Trocadero and a bit longer in the other direction to the Champs Elysees so sight seeing on foot is not a problem but there is a metro station and a red bus tour stop at the Trocadero as well. (The red bus tour is 26 euros per person for two days unlimited hop on hop off travel so we used this to get across town which was a big time saver and reasonable value) Check in was friendly and fast and our request for a quiet room was acknowledged and we were offered a room on the fourth floor which we appreciated and a porter will help with luggage which is good because the lift will only just accomodate 2 people and one suitcase. The room itself was so incredibly tiny even compared to others we have stayed in in Paris. The photo i have uploaded was taken with my back right up against the door and as you will see there is no space at all. If you intend to stay for more than a few days might be worth asking if they can store your suitcases somewhere for you. Now our very minor niggles. While we were unpacking we found someone elses sock under the chair so that didnt inspire confidence. Then in the bathroom the fittings were very tired with a couple of cracked tiles and a stained toilet seat which are unforgivable at this calibre of hotel and cant be explained away by "character" or "chic". The rest of the room was more than fine though with bright and clean linens, carpets and curtains etc. The bed was comfy and clean and the most important thing for me in any hotel - we had a fantastic nights sleep both nights with no outside noise and very little from other guests after about midnight. We had room service the first night which was adequate but expensive so we walked to the cafe malakoff which is on the Trocadero and had breakfast there everyday. Much cheaper, excellent quality food and a good mix of locals(always a good sign) and tourists so a good ambience. The first day we came back in the afternoon for a nap and found that the room had not been touched but got disturbed at about 5pm by the maid service. OK, they were probably busy but then on Sunday morning we were having a lie in and she tried again at 9.00am. Having said that she (as were all the staff) was incredibly friendly and helpful and smiling. Thats all the niggles out of the way, all the rest was positive. We asked if they had a plug adapter as we had forgotten ours and were told it would be sent up to our room while we were out and we could keep it till we checked out. We came back and there it was. We asked if we could leave our luggage with them on our last day as we had a late flight and this wasnt a problem and they arranged a taxi for us at the same time. They were very helpful in suggesting itineraries and places to go and couldnt have been more helpful. If you want to experience a bit of olde world Paris in quiet surroundings with the nicest and most friendly of staff (especially Louise and Thomas on the front desk and Franco the porter) then this is the place for you. If you want modern surroundings in the middle of a lively area it isn't. We will be here again next year. thank you. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location- great staff”
Reviews.Author: Siselle
Reviews.Content: Good location, great breakfast and friendly staff! Had 4 amazing days here in Paris. Would really like to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: htembe
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris for a meeting and stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. The location is superb, within walking distance to the Champs Elysees, and other famous sites. My only problem was the ridiculous tiny room i was in. Just avoid room 507 if ever go there...it's smallest hotel room i've seen. Other than that, it's a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, but perfectly elegant...”
Reviews.Author: HotelsforLife
Reviews.Content: Radisson BLu Le Dokhan's Hotel is a wonderful, small hotel located in the west side of Paris in the Trocadero district - just a stone's throw from the Eiffel Tower. Since it was our anniversary the hotel kindly upgraded our room into a larger Deluxe room which was fine. Since we saw two rooms, I can say that the rooms are very nicely decorated with typically Parisian wall papers and decor all round. They are not particularly big, but who needs a big room as long as you have a king sized bed with lovely soft linen?! Perhaps the greatest thing this wonderful little hotel offered was the room service breakfast hot chocolate. Yes the fresh croissants were nice with French jams to accompany, but the hot chocolate was absolutely divine. Large cups of molten, creamy chocolate. I have never ever had anything like it! Since the hotel is located in Trocadero, the streets are nice and quiet at night, and safe too which was comforting, and it took two minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower, or a 10 minute taxi into central Paris (Louvre) which cost about 15 euros. Somethign fantastic about the hotel which they do not advetise is that there are three Paris street bike stands within 100 metres of the hotel. For English people, these are 'Boris bikes', for everyone else these are bikes which you can hire for 5 euros a day and cycle anywhere and then return in any stand around the city. Since we had wonderful weather, we wraped up warm and went down the hill from the Trocadero, along the river banks of the Seine to the Louvre and then into the quaint Jewish quarter further east. It was magical and the cost was minimal. There is an Apple App you can download (for free when using the hotel's free wi-fi) called Velo-Libre (French for 'Free Bike) which shows you how many bikes are around, or free docking stations there are at each location etc... Downstairs in the hotel is a small, but elegant Champagne bar. They serve a decent variety by the glass, and it is refreshing to see a hotel bar that was busy in the evening time. I spoke to a local couple who said it was the oldest Champagne Bar in Paris, which was backed up by the Receptionist upon check-out. The hotel lift isn't adorned, but actually made out of Louis Vuitton trunks! No really. It is without doubt the coolest lift ever.. especially if you have a girlfriend who enjoys glamourous photos! This is not a 5* hotel, but it is a very good 4* hotel that knows exactly what it is, and does it better than anyone else in my opinion. If you fancy going to Paris for a romantic break where you will either be under the duvet, or out seeing the main attractions this is the place for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Adafa
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed twice at this hotel and on both occasions I have been impressed with the warmth of the welcome and the charm of the rooms. On both occasions, it has been a business trip, but I can't wait to take my family as well. The location near Trocadero is good and the immediate surroundings are really interesting - markets, shops and restaurants. Front desk has been extremely helpful on both occasions. Breakfast service was also excellent. A great find.in a good location with the kind of staff that will mean I will use the property as my Paris base.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Parisian experience”
Reviews.Author: security2Nj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Blu Le Dokhan, December 1st-8th, 2011. Once again my wonderful agent Jackie from Absolute Travel, Hillside NJ, recommended and booked this trip for me with passes to the museums etc. in hand. I did not have to worry about any of those things when I arrived in Paris. What an amazing vacation. She knocked it outta the park as usual with this trip. I am already researching another trip for her to book for me. This hotel is surely a 4 star! I was highly impressed by the level of service, cleanliness and professionalism at The Radisson Blu Le Dokhan. If you want a true old school Parisian experience when you visit Paris, then you stay here! If you want American standards with American service then stay elsewhere. This hotel is definitely where I will be staying on my return visit to Paris. I felt as if I had the entire hotel to myself. It was the perfect accommodations for a great price. Transportation from airport to hotel: We used Air City service to go back and forth from Charles De Gaulle Airport (30-40minute ride). Be aware that the Parisian driving is something out of an action movie. Make sure to keep your seat belts tightly fasten and enjoy the crazy ride. Air City will send a fax to your hotel 24 hours prior to your departure from the hotel informing you of the time they will be at your hotel for your pick up and return to the airport. The front desk staff at Radisson Blu Le Dokhan is very much on top of this, but it would be the “responsible” thing for you yourself to stop at the front desk and inquire about your transportation to the airport. The front desk staff will also print your boarding passes (if applicable) for you and place in your room at your request. Main Lobby/Check in Area: Once you arrive to the Radisson Blu Le Dokhan and walk into the hotel the first time, your initial reaction is “hmm, small but quaint”. You will not be too far off on this reaction; the foyer area is clean, neat, open enough where you are not cramped and has seating. Also, they have a strong perfume scent once you walk into the foyer area. As you walk through the foyer you will immediately see a small check-in desk to your right, seats 2 front desk clerks. To your left is a very elegant, comfy seating area that just sings Parisian atmosphere. This was one of my favorite places to be in the hotel and I just feel in love with the small fireplace there. (Great place for tea or coffee and a little snack). 2 gentlemen that you will most likely encounter from the minute you arrive will be Franco or Kerrin(sp?). These guys know there stuff. (Franco struck me as very knowledgeable and extremely professional. Franco is a most “seasoned” employee). At your time of check in they will try to give you as much information as possible with the most helpful map (this map I kept with me at all times) all highlighted for you. Do not be overwhelmed (it can seem that way) but they are just trying to ensure you get the most of a “good thing” immediately. Your room will most likely not be ready before 2pm so they will take your bags and store them for you. We had arrived around 11:30am there so Franco recommended us to walk (7 minute walk) to Café Trocadero. We ended up frequenting this café during our stay. It helped that our main view was the Eiffel Tower! See more on this café in my food section. Oh by the way, yes, almost everyone speaks perfect English at the front desk! Rooms: We returned from breakfast/lunch at Café Trocadero and were told our luggage was already placed in our room. I thought this was a nice touch because we did not have to take it ourselves. We got onto the tiny Louis Vuitton lift which will fit 3 people very tightly. If you are on the heavier side, then it “might” fit 2. So not having to take our own luggage was nice. 506 was our room and I just loved the 100% Parisian feel to it. This room was considered an upgrade deluxe. You walk into a tiny area, to your right was the shower and vanity with lovely amenities, and to your left was a tiny room with the toilet (all marble this was a sharp, clean look to me). As you walked into the room, there was another door (this was nice because when one person is in the shower you can close that area out as you stay in the bedroom). The bedroom area was a typical European room. Small (considering this was a Deluxe) but very nicely decorated, flat screen TV (only 2 English channels and they were news), nice work desk (I kept my laptop (wifi included) and phone etc. on this desk.) and 2 chairs with a small coffee table. And my favorite thing in our room was the amazingly huge French glass doors that opened out to a very nice balcony. Beautiful drapes were hung at this magnificent door. This just screamed “Paris” to me. The bed at the Radisson Blu Le Dokhan had to be the most comfortable bed and pillows I have ever slept on in all my travels. It was extremely hard to get out of bed every morning. This was a dangerous thing; it was like lying in heaven. I would go on and on about this bed but I hope you got the idea. So, good luck getting out of it. We had 3 pieces of luggage, so we emptied one and stored some sweaters in the closet and hung a few other pieces of clothing. One luggage was on the stand(comes with every hotel room) in the corner by the doors leading to the balcony and the 3 luggage fit snug on the opposite side of the bed in front of the large mirror on the floor. I hope this will help you understand how to situate your items for your trip. The Radisson provides 2 very nice robes with slippers for convenience, one in the shower and the second in the bedroom closet. On our first night with Radisson, we also received a “welcome” gift of cookies and sweet treats. A very simple touch that makes guest feel special. Turn down service is nice and they leave you little sweets in your room. Laundry: I am a traveler who hates to fly with dirty clothes so when we arrived at the Radisson and I noticed directly across the street (small streets so about 10 steps away) was a laundry facility, I was thrilled. The day before we had to leave we took all our laundry and (now do not laugh) Kerrin from the front desk. (Poor guy, super sweet to walk over to help us). He helped us to understand how much money was needed and how the soap etc. worked. It was very easy once Kerrin showed us what each item meant in English. I highly recommend taking advantage of this convenience. Champagne Bar: If you are reading this review then it means you are semi familiar with the Radisson Blu Le Dokhan and have heard of their famous Champagne Bar. This room is just past the reception desk on your right. This is a small, elegant very old school/rustic Parisian influenced room. We were at the Champagne Bar every night and even booked the Champagne and Caviar tasting one night. There were two gentlemen working there but the one we had the pleasure of meeting every night and interacting with was Anthony Gomes. This young man has a bright future ahead of him the in the Culinary and Champagne world. I do not know much about champagnes but after listening to Anthony, you cannot help but leave there feeling properly educated. The one regret I have is that I did not approach him sooner about taking us on a day trip to a champagne region of his choice. But now I know for my next trip to Paris and Radisson Blu to talk to Anthony about this. I noticed a few clients came into the champagne bar and in my opinion was a bit rude when he would explain to them about the champagne they were about to have. People, this is not a pub, this is an elegant well rounded Champagne Bar where you come for a great experience and a lesson in what you are consuming. It is not just a place for a drink. You can go to a local pub for that. Certain nights they will have live entertainment there so be sure to ask for a schedule. Food: We ate at Café Trocadero-tip on café’s like this one. There are 2 types of seating. The one on the inside is a different menu than the tables you see around the café on the outside. We learned this the hard way. It does not matter that it is the same Café, they will not serve you from the other menu on the table outside. Our first time there we wanted something along the line of breakfast. We went inside to sit and they give us a lunch menu, I looked at the person sitting one table away from me having coffe and eggs with a baguette. When I asked for that menu I was told “No, this is lunch”. Hope you get the point. In the winter time, it really is not too bad to sit outside some of these café’s because they have the best heat lamps. Keeps you nice and warm. Plus when you sit outside, you can people watch as well as watch the crazy driving in front of you. Café Trocadero and Café Kessler were perfect for this. The Eiffel Tower was the main site in front of these 2 café’s so how could you not hand out there?! Louise at our hotel front desk also recommend a restaurant (10 minute walk) on Victor Hugo called Brassiere Le Stella, this place had great food, great seafood towers yummy escargot etc. We ate there twice. At the end of the day we would always stop at a local street stand/vendor and get a nutella crepe and during the day hot dogs (very yummy). You cannot beat the local street vendor cuisine for a true local Parisian experience. Room service at the hotel was not a bad thing either. Breakfast and Dinner was very nice. Not as good as the restaurants on the outside, but not bad either. Location of hotel: Radisson Blu Le Dokhan is “PERFECTLY” located in the 16th arrondissement! This hotel is surrounded by restaurants and café’s. But it is the ultimate location for walking to the Eiffel Tower (7-11 minute walk) and to Arc De Triumph/Champ Elysse (10-12 minutes). At the time we were there the Christmas markets were just opening up. The ones at the end of the Champ Elysee were wonderful. The ones buy the Eiffel Tower and the St. Germain area was opening the day we left (12/8/11). So that is a tip for you if you plan on doing a Christmas trip to Paris. The second week of December seems to be the best time to see it all. Staff: The staff members that stood out to us were Louise, Kerrin, Franco and of course Anthony Gomes. There was one other gentleman at the front desk that worked the early shift with Franco and I am sorry to say I forgot his name. These staff members were like friends to us and not just hotel employees. Louise was a great conversional person. We loved speaking with her. Franco was like your protector and overseer, he was fabulous. Kerrin, well this kid helped us with our laundry across the street, I mean it does not get any better. Anthony, my Champagne sommelier, we loved chatting with him and learning from him. You can see he has a shy side but once you get to chatting with him, it is like an old friend. The housekeeping staff was just so polite and very sweet. Tips: The shower at this hotel has a “dial” looking device between the water nozzles. This is the temperature control for the water. So try not to scold yourself with the hot. We did that in the beginning, which is how we learned what that dial was for. The slightest turn on that dial drastically changes the temperature. There is a small grocery store 1minute walk from the hotel on the same street (they are actually everywhere) where I recommend you go get some bottle water, sodas, wine etc for your room. This will help with your expense. I do have a few tips on the Eiffel Tower and best way to get up and not have to wait in line as well as Taxis. But it is way too much to type on here. So if anyone is interested, feel free to contact me through Trip Advisor. For any other tips, same advice, just contact me.

Reviews.Title: “A very good option in Paris. TINY ROOMS!”
Reviews.Author: CocoFranco
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central and tastefully decorated. It's just off the Place de Victor Hugo in West/Central Paris and within walking distance to Champs Elysee, Arc and Eiffel Tower. The interiors are very Parision and the rooms are beautifully decorated but absolutely tiny by US standards. Nonetheless for Paris, I would definintely stay here again. When we were there, the lift was broken and there were minor maintenance issues but these are overlooked because you're in Paris afterall. Management is very attentive and everyone's English language skills are good.

Reviews.Title: “Classy but nice too”
Reviews.Author: andyw555
Reviews.Content: What a lovely little hotel! We wanted a quick break in Paris and this was the perfect choice. Its Near the Eiffel Tower and Trocadero. Very well furnised (if small) rooms, comfortable beds, friendly staff, Continental breakfast simple but of good quality. I had my doubts about the Luis Vitton-lined lift but my other half thought it was wonderful and kept caressing acquisitively. Overall great and we would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: sophiesow7
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a weekend away and thought it was perfect. Very cosy and charming. Breakfast was nice, we only had continental included and to get extras it was costly to say the least. But it is Paris after all so this was expected. The staff were lovely, couldn't do enough for us especially the reception staff. We also received a complimentary upgrade to a deluxe room which was a pleasant surprise! We were a young couple on a weekend away and the only thing I can say is that we didn't find the area as lively as we would have hoped. We went to see the moulin rouge show on our last night and that area seemed a bit more "youthful" but overall a fantastic little hotel, and would love to go back at some point in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight”
Reviews.Author: northwest1
Reviews.Content: An overnight business trip to Paris took me to the Radisson Blu on reccomendation from the company I was visiting. On arrival at 1630 my room was not ready ! however I was offered a complimentary drink from the bar, 30 minutes later my room was ready. Quite nice but very small, I relaise it's Paris but this was small, I am not a big guy but had to reverse into bathroom. That said it was clean and comfortable, the bed was really comfortable and the room was also very quiet, given it location that was a plus. Overall my only critisim would be the bathroom size the rest was all ok, the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not much room”
Reviews.Author: tommillerjones
Reviews.Content: Good points - Really comfortable bed, excellent linen Efficient shower Competent staff Elegant, comfortable public rooms Not so good - Catering (not really geared up for anything, even breakfast with disappointing selection of breads served at very small tables) Tiny lift Poor - Lack of hanging space, nowhere to store other clothes, little room for baggage. General - pleasant for a short stay but limited space in "Classic" bedrooms make it unsuitable for longer periods. "Superior" rooms might be better.

Reviews.Title: “Charme de l'Ancienne”
Reviews.Author: a_biermann
Reviews.Content: We went for a short weekend in November and booked with Radisson miles. The hotel staff is exceptionally friendly, the room (while very small) cute, and comfortable (and it's Paris, so how much time do you want to spend in the room). The hotel feels like walking into a private residence. The champagne bar is splendid. We will certainly go again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel makes you feel like you are back in 18th century!”
Reviews.Author: Ewout
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. At the entrance you feel straight away that you are going to enjoy an authentic hotel, really back in time! The lift looks like you are in a Louis Vuitton suitcase from 100 years ago. All employees are whispering and there is a really low volume classical music. There is attention to details and you are not bothered with any unnessecary marketing collaterals or whatsoever. At the reception we met Louise who was extremely nice and friendly. She made us feel at home. The baggagist Karim was very attentive and our luggage was waiting in our room as we arrived too early with our room not ready yet. Room for improvement: we would suggest a complimentary bottle of water and a espresso machine. These small basics would make this hotel even better!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: SunWorshipper067
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at this hotel twice for the year, and must say that I wouldn't stay anywhere else when visiting Paris! The staff are ever so friendly and helpful! The concierge is the best - anything you need he tries his best to accommodate!! The rooms are spacious and each is decorated with a lovely French flair. Truly feels like home!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: Rois
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using Radisson points but I have to say I would pay for it any time. It is an absolutely charming hotel in a clean, quiet area and very accessible. The staff were amazing, and we felt like we were the only guests in the place. We had stayed the two nights previously in the Latin Quarter and the difference was absolutely astounding - this is the romantic Paris, not the tourist-trap Paris. Our room was on the top floor and was tiny, but perfectly adequate with a fabulous outlook over Paris rooftops at sunset. The champagne bar was classy and we started off our evening in style. The waiter was incredibly attentive. I really can't fault this hotel, it lived up to all my Paris expectations for a leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: vixinhaler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a three night stay at Le Dokhan and rate it as one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in. Its location is superb, within 15 minutes walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysees, Grand Palais, Arc de Triomphe. There are nearby metro stations which take you further afield but on the whole Paris, unlike some other capital cities, is incredibly accessible. The staff were fantastic and couldn't do enough to help, Jean Phillippe was especially curteous and helpful. The hotel itself is beautiful, small and quirky with exceptional attention to detail and the room was immaculate. The rooms are small but adequte in size and decorated to a high standard. There is a Champagne Bar which we visited every night before venturing out for supper. The waiters were all incredibly informative about the various wines and champagnes. The decor is traditional and stunning, including the Louis Vuitton lift which apparently is about to undergo a refurbishment. We will definitely be back. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kayleigh g
Reviews.Content: i took my boyfriend to this beautifull hotel for a suprise birthday treat! it was an amazing weekend, and the hotel was lovely. it was brilliant value for money, it was clean, great location and complete with a jacuzzi! this hotel made our weekend very special and we will never forget it. The staff we very friendly. we went to the moulan rouge for the evening which was fantastic. i would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel In A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal4_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights at the Radisson Blu Le Dokhan's Hotel in Paris and the location couldn't be better; located on the right bank in between the Arc de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower and only a short walk to the Tracadero where you can catch the 6 or the 9 metro. Top notch personnel who make you feel right at home and are the most helpful and friendly people you hope to meet. Every problem and question answered with efficiency and great recommendations for restaurants, tours and directions. I saved so much money in Versailles by catching the RER myself and getting the Passport Pass arranged by the Bellboy, Franco instead of arranging a tour. The Concierge, Jean-Philippe and Front Office Manager, Louise were also so helpful, friendly and always had a warm smile. The rooms are small but if you get one with two single beds (pushed together anyway) as compared to one bed, the room is a little larger. Who wants to stay inside for long anyway? This is Paris! The beds are quite comfortable and the hotel is neat and clean at all times. Will absolutely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, staff and comfort excellence.”
Reviews.Author: Forsterfan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a superior room at this hotel. We completely enjoyed our stay and cannot fault anything. These are the main stand outs: Location - the hotel is located between the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe (a 10 min walk each way). There are also a number of very good restaurants in the area as well as shopping. Staff - the staff were extremely friendly, fun and spoke very good English. In particular, Jean-Phillipe, Louise and Anthony were stand outs. They made good recommendations for restaurants and gave good advice all round. The hotel has a champagne bar (the first in Paris) and offers a wide selection of Champagnes. Anthony gave us good advice in this area including what champagne houses to visit in Epernay - we took his advice and it was a great experience. Atmosphere and comfort - the hotel is beautifully decorated in a relaxed french provincial style. The rooms are very comfortable - beds are so soft! We loved this hotel so much that we will definitely stay here next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and located”
Reviews.Author: Greg_TorontoCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Le Dokhan. The service was excellent and we were very happy with this hotel. It is close to many restaurantes and to Trocadero. We walked there our last night in Paris and was treated to an amazing view of the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are small but very comfortable. For couples, this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small botique hotel”
Reviews.Author: pataelliott
Reviews.Content: We chose a Delta Vacations package that included 4 days in Paris and 3 in Amsterdam for outselves as well as our son and his family. What a find this small hotel was! An ideal location near the Metro, and just 2 blocks from the Tracadero area with an outstanding view of the Eifel Tower. The rooms were small but very tastefully decorated. The staff was warm and friendly, the breakfast room was small and cozy and the breakfast pastries were delicious! Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie T
Reviews.Content: We arrived in at Radisson Blu Le Dokhan's midday, we were greeted by the most friendly doorman/concierge. We were just early for check- in but that didnt matter because we wanted to get sightseeing straight away. We checked-in and they stored our bags for us. Our concierge got us a map, highlighted the must see spots and of course some spots that the locals love! He made our first day in Paris so great with his easy english and helpful guidance. We went up to our room, third floor, and were welcomed with a bottle of French Champagne and a note from management congratulating us on our marriage. The room was quite large for Paris with lots of stripes! Very chic! Throughout our 7 night stay we were unable to fault this hotel. The breakfast was great, the staff were extremely friendly (everyday!) they were so helpful with everything like maps, must see shops and even some side boutique shops! One day it was even raining and they were unable to call for a taxi, lines were busy, our doorman ran down the street and hailed a taxi back to the hotel for us! Its a perfect location, close to the Eiffle Tower and the main lines for the "hop on hop off" buses. There is a laundromat over the road along with a bakery and supermarket that have some gorgeous local wines and cheeses and anything you really need. Loved our stay- It was a great start to our honeymoon!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT.....”
Reviews.Author: PATRICE1270
Reviews.Content: We have been thousand of times in Paris ...but this time was a perfect get away.We were ( my wife , my 2 children and myself) warmly greeted by Louise and were pleasantly surprised to find our rooms was upgraded at no charge! The room was the most beautiful room you can imagine. The staff is so friendly & so helpful - they were able to help organise some of our sightseeing, But the Hotel ....is even more beautiful ...a little gem in Paris and so well located between the Trocadero and the Champs Elysees No words to describe this heaven of calm, peace and luxury in the middle of Paris !!!!No doubts ..we will come back . A real special thanks to Louise and all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a fantastic position”
Reviews.Author: azertyuiop_9
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in this lovely hotel, positioned just 2 minutes walk from Le Trocadero and 5 minutes from the Champs Elysees and the Arcde Triumph. The staff couldn't do enough for us recommending the best way to get around Paris, the best places to dine and things to look out for as we rambled around the city. The rooms are on the smaller side but are kept immaculately clean, our only gripe was that the air conditioning in our room (502) wasn't working and it wasn't fixed when we reported it to the reception but they did offer to move us to another room. I would definately book this hotel again and would highly recommend it to anyone wanting an authentic french hotel in a prime position.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - amazing staff!!”
Reviews.Author: jarberg
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending four nights in this charming hotel. Yes, our room was small, but as many people have said, you don't go to Paris and stay in your room. Our room was spotless, the location was superb, and the staff at the hotel ranks among the best I have seen. Everyone went out of their way to make sure we were happy. The night concierge, Jean-Phillipe, made reservations for us every night and recommended fabulous places to eat that were in our price range. The day concierge even walked down to Victor Hugo square to get us a cab. The staff definitely made our stay there - I can't say enough wonderful things about them!! When we return to Paris, i will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hospitality and service!"”
Reviews.Author: gansclan
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at this lovely, quiet hotel. The staff made us feel like we were family. The hotel's location was perfect for walking and/or catching the Metro. We loved every moment of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: girlfromokla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for almost two weeks. We were very happy with the hotel because we had wanted to stay at a place like a bed and breakfast. Don't misunderstand this comment. I say it because it was a very small hotel which did not feel like a chain at all. It was cozy and at the same time modern in what it provided. The staff was extremely helpful and gave us lots of good advice. We spent a lot of time out and about so the size of the room (small compared to the American room) did not bother us. The beds were clean and comfortable. The details of the the hotel were charming and really added to our experience. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “small , charming , and very french”
Reviews.Author: loveslife
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasure to stay at a brand hotel ( Radisson ) that did not feel at all like a brand but rather a very unique personal and quirky hotel that felt historic and one of a kind. We had a very nice corner room overlooking the street with a very french decor. The service could not be more helpful and welcoming and even though I was traveling on points , I felt treated like a very wanted guest. The neighborhood is full of little restuarants and local stores , and it is a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, even better location!!”
Reviews.Author: katepullan
Reviews.Content: My bf suprised me with a trip to Paris in April and booked this hotel, what a good choice!! You've got the main attractions literally about 5 mins walk away so its an amazing base for a sightseeing trip. The hotel itself is goregous, inside and out! the downstaires seating area/lobby is beautiful! The staff are all friendly and really helpful. We had a standard room on the 4th floor, the bed was huuuge! Again beautifully decorated, bit on the small side but you don't spend alot of time in the room if your out and about so its not a problem. Some great little cafes and resturants literally right on the hotels doorstep - if I ever go back to Paris again (fingers crossed!) we would stay here again no doubt about it!

Reviews.Title: “Your 'own residence' in the Trocadero area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: whiteswan79
Reviews.Content: We found this on Trip Advisor and were impressd with the high satisfaction rate. Now I can see why! The staff, without exception were brilliant, understanding, happy, helpful and gave up as much time as you wanted to organise your day. The location is convenient for Metro, boat trips, good restaurants and cafes. It is in what seems like a diplomatic quarter and quiet at night and felt safe to wander about. A quality part of town. The prices may be higher therefore for eating and drinking. We would repeat a previous Trip Advisor's recommendation for breakfast, turn right out of the hotel and 50 yards to Salle Climatisee in Rue Lauriston. For a meal out we enjoyed Il Conte, just over the road and for a more expensive (but very good) eat try Brasserie de la Poste, 54 Rue de Longchamp, 150 yards away, phone 01 47 55 01 31. We chose Les Cars Rouge (or red open top hop on off buses) to get some idea of what was where (my first trip! ashamed to say). 26 Euro each for a two day ticket. After a hectic day sightseeing and the same friendly greeting, then a trip in the rather unusual lift, it is a bit small, (two people in comfort. More would be intimate!) old, but reliable. The decor is superb with textile lining the walls in our de luxe room, not wallpaper, a real quality feel with a table and two chairs and plenty of space. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom luxuriously appointed although a quirky shape as we were in 305 at the 'pointy end' of the hotel. (The hotel being at the junction of two streets and therefore triangular in shape). We enjoy a cup of tea in the morning so the staff kindly supplied a kettle and some milk. A memorable stay and we would go again. Thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Hotel with Fabulous Staff”
Reviews.Author: sellinglikecrazy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for more than a week. Staff is fabulous--excellent recommendations and response to some problems we had. Air conditioning was non existent our first night--but was fixed by the second night--and we were given a fan that we continued to use all week. Linens are fabulous--crisp and fresh. Great shampoos et al. The fabulous lift is a restructured Louis Vuitton trunk--quirky and adorable. The public rooms are sparkling--like a bohemian salon drawing room of the 1920s. Breakfast service tries hard--and when you get it--is very good. But there never seem to be enough people on duty to make it go smoothly. Phone did not work. Shower was a step over in the tub--but scads of hot water and good pressure. Once again--staff from front desk to chambermaids was superb. Don't use the mini bar--just pop across the street to the mini mart called 8 to 8--grab your goodies for 1/10th the price. Short 5 minute stroll to Trocadero metro. No problem with noise on the street side of the 4th floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Faded lady whose time has run out?”
Reviews.Author: lteast
Reviews.Content: I have tried hard to like Dokhans over the last 5 years, very french, faded grandeur, nicely appointed rooms, etc, but I have had enough! In the last 2 visits, we have had to change rooms 4 times. Broken thermostat in bath, broken aircon, curtains that do not close, phone that did not work, door handles in bathroom falling off, aircon dripping on floor, broken toilet seat, strong smell of cleaning fluid, etc. Stained curtains, and walls. The iconic bathrooms, where your knees touch the wall when on the toiletI can put up with, but not the general air of neglect. Worn carpet on stairs is a feature. The staff try very hard, and are very helpful, but I can see why Sofitel wanted to give up the management. The hotel is also noisy, as the windows , tho charming, do not fit very well, and the hotel is between 2 roads. It is a 4 star hotel, and needs a complete refit to justify that status.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay !!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrspjr
Reviews.Content: We felt very welcome, the staff were great esp. Louise and Franco (hope I spelled your names right). The hotel is also very clean, room was small as expected from a boutique hotel, but bed and pillows were very comfortable. Location was also perfect, 5 mins walk to trocadero, near arc de triomphe and champ elysees, very near cafes and restaurants, neighborhood is quiet, can be easily explored walking. Turn right to rue lauriston and on the left side is a cafe "salle climatisee", our favorite breakfast place. Also go right to rue saint didier and on the left side is galerie saint didier, there are lots of stalls where you can grab something to eat and a grocery inside. Across the street is a fruit stand and a convenience store. Overall it met all our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: LW1988
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Room service is quick at reasonable prices. Towels, robes, bedding, slippers washed daily. Soaps and shower gels replaced daily at no extra cost. The Eiffel tower is less than 5 mins walk away and there are plenty of restaurants nearby. Coffee is cheap enough in the hotel and there is a cheap supermarket and pharmacy around the corner. At the end of the avenue is Trocadero metro station. The only bad thing I could say about this hotel is that it is at least an hour away from the airport, to which you must take two trains.

Reviews.Title: “Fall in love in and with Paris”
Reviews.Author: antonioandgemma
Reviews.Content: We had a one-night-whirlwind trip to Paris as a surprise birthday/valentines treat for my wife. I organised it and based my selection on trip advisor. This hotel was highly rated, but not the highest. The reason for choosing it was that it had an element of grandeur about it (as it was a treat). The hotel is fantastically positioned - 10 minutes to the champs elysee and arc de triomphe, and about the same to the eiffel tower. Trocadero metro is a 5 minute walk too. In the area there are plenty of bars/restaurants, as well as mini markets if required. All in all, I thought the location perfect for us. The decor and feel of the hotel was lovely. it's quite a small hotel, not huge by any means, but we liked that and it made it feel all the more personal. The lobby is quite nice, and the lift to the rooms whilst small, (and I mean really small!) is really funky, decorated in luis vuiton. We loved it - some people moan about it but it's a fun twist. Rooms are tastefully done; ours was room 208 with materialed-walls. Beds were very comfy. pillows deightful and I think most rooms have doors opening to a false balcony which was nice. Now to the the staff. I know full well that this aspect revolves around having the right character(s) working for you; all of the staff we encountered had the very best attitude and made us feel welcome, valued yet not in a sickly way. As an example, the lady on reception (Louise I think her name was) came out from behind the counter to chat to us as we checked in. Like I say it was quite personal but not intrusive nor over the top - it was actually very nice to feel so welcomed. Jean Pierre the concierge was very very good. He has a fantastic knowledge of the area, and is a great "fixer" - if you have any questions or things you need to book or work out, dont be shy, ask Jean Pierre - he will help you make the most of your trip. I noticed some people moaning about room size and price - it's Paris, everything is expensive, the rooms are more than adequate. You're in Paris, you've paid your money, enjoy the place and the friendship; Trust me, it's a great place to stay; perfect, small, very comfy, welcoming, helpful, well-positioned. ps. it has a renowned champagne bar in the hotel, but we ran out of time! If you want to fall in love again, go to the Radisson Blu Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely a credit to all Radisson Hotels”
Reviews.Author: happyholz
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on Saturday 11th December, did not have one thing to complain about. From the moment we walked in the door pure gold service. The room was beautiful with the Louis Vuitton lift leading up to it. The bed was definately the most comfiest bed ever after a long walk around Paris it was pure luxury. The reception staff were only happy to help with all aspects from advising on resturants to booking Eiffel Tower tickets, would definately recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory hotel in 16ieme”
Reviews.Author: bbanks945
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Best Western Trocadero La Tour last year. This Radisson beats it hands down. Room was a bit smaller, but much more nicely decorated. Better staff, better location.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: AW001
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with my adult daughter. Friendly and welcoming staff, lovely room, excellent location within a short walk of the Eiffel Tower, and close to two metro stations. Only criticism: very poor breakfast service, particularly on one morning when it appeared that only one member of staff was on duty. Apparently the hotel was short-staffed at the time. Food was good when it eventually arrived. Despite this, would certainly return here and thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay - nice location”
Reviews.Author: Dogger70
Reviews.Content: Great place, nice charn, refreshingly local versus big chain. Some very nice staff. Room was pretty small, but clean and nicely decorated. Some staff more knowledgable and helpful then others, but all friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: stray
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in this hotel for five nights. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It is nice to be in an area that is primarily residential and quiet, but still is close to many nice cafes and restaurants. As has been said before, the rooms are quite small, but are charmingly decorated. We had a lovely view over the street, roofs and balconies. The bathroom is small, and the room with the toilet is tiny. The beds are very comfortable, with good quality linens. Our maid service was inconsistant, and we only had turndown service three out of five nights. However, all the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Jean Phillipe at the front hall was exceptional. He was always able to answer our questions about directions, restaurants, and shopping. When we returned to the hotel from our wanderings, it felt like our home away from home. My primary suggestion for improvement would be to have more moderate selections in the bar and for room service. Even in Paris, the prices seemed high. That being said, I would definitely consider returing to this hotel on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good and one great strength”
Reviews.Author: faktoader
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location served by the Trocerdero and Victor Hugo metro stations. It is 15 minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs. The breakfast room service is hit and miss depending who is on duty. The Kir Royale at 19 euros was a shock! Rooms are lovely, not huge, but well appointed. But, the great thing about Le Dokhans is Jean Phillipe at front of house. He is so professional, so efficient, can get you into restaurants with a no reservation policy on Saturday night - HE IS A STAR!!! Every hotel should have one! But few do.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location, attentive staff but few problems”
Reviews.Author: Tired_travelling_dad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located near the Trocadero and is accessible by at least three metro stations within 5 minute walk. It is a beautifully decorated hotel with small, but clean rooms (similar size to other Paris hotel rooms). The rooms are quiet with comfortable, large beds. There is a minibar in the room with self charging link to the front desk (be warned - if you have a toddler who likes to take things out)! The bathroom was small but clean with shower and small bathtub. We had a free room upgrade, so the classic room may be smaller! The staff were very attentive especially the man at the door who helped with directions and also moving rooms... which we had to do... Initially stayed on 5th floor in room 504, but with temperatures approaching 30degrees centigrade outside, it was clear airconditioning didn't work... The front desk gave a few tips to improve the situation, as they reported that the aircon was problematic throughout the hotel. But with a screaming toddler who was finding the heat unbearable, we were shown instead to a room on the first floor where the airconditioning was better. Breakfast was good and served in the champagne bar. This room is small so be prepared to wait if the hotel is busy. There is free wifi in the hotel. Room service looked really expensive. The single lift is a tight squeeze but was a source of amusement for our daughter. Local tip: excellent restaurants by Victor hugo metro station. Probably wouldn't return to same hotel again but happy with our long weekend there.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel. Highly recommend the Champagne Bar. C'est magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: Size2shoes
Reviews.Content: My husband arranged our three night stay for our 15th wedding anniversary. The hotel is in an excellent location- just a few minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. The accommodation is very cosy, clean and decadent. I loved it very much.The bed was incredibly comfortable, and the hotel was very quiet. However, during our stay we did encounter a few problems. The waitress working during our first breakfast was incredibly rude. We were very upset by this. We realised that this was due to the fact that she was alone and was under a lot of stress due to the amount of residents - however, we did not hesitate to raise this with the reception staff. This problem was remedied by more staff the following morning. We also received a lovely display of fruit and a handwritten apology. This was reassuring as it was clear that our disppointment had been acted upon. The lift was also out of action, we were located on the third floor, so not really an issue, but I would feel for someone who was on the 6th floor! Again, this was soon fixed. All in all our stay was a very special one and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We would also recommend the Champagne bar. The chap who runs that is a true character and definitely knows his stuff! We spent many a euro on Champagne!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bayoutravel
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris for 2 days on my way back from London (july 21-july 23). This is a beautiful boutique hotel with a small but working elevator. I booked this hotel several months in advance of my trip and got it for almost half price! The staff were very friendly, especially the concierge Jean Phillipe. The hotel is in a very good location and a short walk to the Eifel Tower, metro/subway, and other attractions. The rooms were smaller but I was traveling alone so didnt have a problem. If you forget your adapters/converters for computer or appliances, the front desk will loan them to you. Room service was quite expensive and a cup of coffee was about 8 Euros. I thought that was expensive. Overall, great place and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Topcat1980
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Paris where we went for my husband's birthday. After reading a number of mediocre reviews about the standard of rooms in Paris we were worried about what we would find, and we were very pleasantly suprised. We received a warm welcome from the staff, who were very pleasant and forgiving at our feeble attempts at speaking French. They of course, spoke excellent English. We were pleased to find that they had upgraded us to a deluxe room. The room was lovely, spotlessly clean and very comfortable. The bathroom was very small, but well presented and also spotlessly clean. We were very pleased. The hotel is in a quiet location, (ensuring a peaceful nights sleep) but well situated for the Eiffel Tower, Arc De Triomphe and Champs Elysees - all of which you could walk to in about 20 minutes. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk to the nearest Metro station (Trocadero) so we found this hotel to be in an excellent location for accessing all the sights of Paris without being in the thick of things. The breakfast room is quite small and formal, and it is not very clear as to what kind of breakfast is served. We were given a basket of pastries and coffee etc when we went down, and we (stupidly) assumed that it was just a continental breakfast, but as we left we saw other people with omlettes - so dont make the same mistake as we did. We would definately stay in this hotel again. I can imagine that visitors from the US or Canada might be disappointed by the size of the rooms, but unfortunately rooms at their side of the Pond are much more generous then they are in European cites, and so this should be expected, but all in all we had a lovely stay in a lovely hotel and would like to thank the staff. I would recommend to other Paris 'first timers' to make use of a weekend Metro ticket (20 Euros each for a 3 day ticket) The Metro system in Paris is excellent and saves you no end of walking. I would also recommend booking your tickets to go up the Eiffel Tower in advance on the internet of you can - the queues are absolutely crazy. If you are unable to do this (as we were) get to the tower for about 08:30 to joint the queue. It doesn't open until 9am, but it's worth getting there early to avoid waiting in a ridiculous line. Lastly - watch out for dog poo! It's all over the streets of Paris and even the Metro!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: josborne01
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in this hotel! We stayed a few days in the Summer of 2010 and highly recommend it. Here are a few notes and tips: - It is a very cozy and traditional-style boutique hotel. Very pretty, pleasant and quiet. - Its right near the Eiffel tower and the Trocadero metro station. 5 minute walk. - Plenty of cafes and restaurants around. For more authentic options, head in the opposite direction of the Eiffel Tower. For example, up to Victor Hugo square. Its not as touristy. - The hotel staff are wonderful here. Forget all the stereotypes about rude Frenchmen. The staff here are extremely helpful and speak English very well. They are what made our stay so enjoyable. They will call and arrange dinner reservations, taxis, river cruises or whatever you like. Its like having a French travel agent at your disposal! Don’t hesitate to ask them for advice. - Try the Stella restaurant nearby. Its at the intersection of Victor Hugo and Rue St-Didier. Another nice non-touristy area for cafes and restaurants. - Our room was well appointed and high quality. Yes, it was kind of small. But this Paris. Not Vegas. Big hotels rooms don’t exist here … unless you want to spend US$400 per night. - The breakfast is expensive here (like all hotels). Go outside and grab a pancake or a croissant at one of the cafes nearby. Its cheaper and more fun. - It is, perhaps, a bit expensive. But I think that if you go much cheaper in Paris, then the quality of the accomodations go WAY down (e.g. unfriendly staff, no air conditioning, etc). So I believe this place is worth the little extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get, but great location”
Reviews.Author: mlove17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a stay with the Le Dokhan Paris hotel as part of a larger Paris vacation package, and thankfully paid significantly less than the prices advertised in their lobby. We were very surprised to see that standard room rates were between 500 - 600 EUR-- definitely NOT worth what you get at the hotel. The hotel is a small boutique hotel, which is to be expected in the 16th arrondisement of Paris and is not necessarily a bad thing. In fact, the hotel sits in one of the quietest and nicest neighborhoods of Paris. However, what is included (which is nearly nothing) at the hotel versus what you pay is a large difference. The beds were extremely comfortable, but the entire hotel had a very stuffy "old wealth" feel to it. The internet was complimentary which was very nice, but it cost 30 euros to watch tv. My husband and I were on our honeymoon (in Paris) so we didn't care very much about watching TV, but thought it was odd that a place would charge for it. Breakfast also cost over 25 euro per person, when you could literally step right outside of the building and have breakfast at a Parisian cafe for half the price, if even that. Overall we couldn't really complain about our stay, as I stated before that we got a great deal on our room rate. If we had paid 500 euros for it, I guarantee we wouldn't have been as adaptable. Our carpet was old and there were stains on our curtains, but again, we were accomodating. The air conditioning of the hotel was also broken, which was not very pleasant during Paris's heat streak the week we were there. All in all, I wouldn't recommend this hotel to someone visiting Paris unless they just had a lot of money to spend and wanted a very private hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, luxurious, friendly Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sally9115
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after staying there for two nights for our 10th Wedding Anniversay. We thought that the hotel was beautiful and the decor was incredible. The location was perfect - less than 5 min stroll to The Eiffle Tower. The welcome was friendly and helpfull. Our room was 'cosy' but the decor again was wonderful and so beautiful it really really didn't matter. The bed was incredibly comfortable - often I do not get a decent nights sleep in hotel beds (!) but this bed was extremely comfortable and we both had two great nights sleep. I thought it was absolutely wonderful and if we return there for our 20th Wedding Annivesary I will be disappointed -BUT only because he hasn't taken me back there sooner!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KGone
Reviews.Content: We spent five fabulous nights at the Radisson Blu. Staff were extremely helpful, room was well decorated and very clean. There are a number of wonderful restaurants and bakeries in the neighborhood, with a handy laundromat directly across the street. Within easy walking distance to Arche de Triomphe and Eiffel Tower. We highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “whats about Radisson in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ele203
Reviews.Content: Paris is one of the most beautiful cities. staying in the Radisson should have accentuated the stay. Radisson is a nice boutique hotel and good for those who like old world charm. I was surprised by the lack of space in the rooms. It becomes cramped. Big guys , watch out for the toilets, you may walk in and get your foot smack into the WC. Having paid for the bed and breakfast, i expected more than croissants, cinnamon bread, small french roll, fruit juice , coffee/tea, jam and butter. Lo behold thats all you will get, if more pay for it. Front desk very pleasant and helpful, and so are the other staff. You will never get a taxi in front of the hotel. But Trocadero metro and main road is close by , walk up and explore the intrigue called Paris. Radisson is close to Eiffel Tower and Champs Elysee. Preferably book two rooms if you want more space........ and if you can afford it. Radisson is an expencivey package for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: DTinDC
Reviews.Content: I spent six nights recently at the Radisson Blu located in the Trocadero. I wholly recommend this hotel. It is true that the rooms are small, but that's typical of European hotels. The room had a very, very comfortable queen size bed and the room itself was clean and well kept. I visited the Champagne Bar, where I was served by Guillaume, a very kind and helpful server. He was an excellent waiter and was willing to talk to is about Paris and France in general. The conceierges were also extremely helpful. After discovering a particular champagne that I liked, the concierge went so far as to contact local wine shops to see where I could locate it. I did not ask for this kindness, but rather he did it of his own volition and he presented me with an address, phone, and directions to the store. Another concierge said to me, verbatim : "I am here for you. Here is my phone number; call me any time day or night and I will help you." as he handed me a card with his mobile number. This kind of service made a huge difference to us because we felt like we had people who were genuinely interested that we enjoyed our stay. All employees speak English very well and are able to assist with questions. The location of the hotel was just a few blocks to the Trocadero and Boissiere train stations. There are excellent restaurants (Le Stella, Le Kleber) nearby where you can eat a good meal for 20Euro or so. This hotel also had free wi-fi. While this may not seem like much of a perk, you will pay for wi-fi service at the cost of 20+ euros a day at other hotels. Because of this, I was able to use my laptop and IPhone with no problem whatsoever to receive/send email, look up flight schedules, etc. Trust me - this was a nice perk. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but expensive experience”
Reviews.Author: Bergern
Reviews.Content: Intimate and cosy hotel with genuine atmosphere. The location is perfect. Short walk to subway, Trocadero, Arc de Triumph and Champs Elysses. The lobby is small, but who needs a hall to check in and out. Excellent service, except for not offering the businessroom free newspaper. Ground floor contains a lounge with a fireplace and the champagnebar/breakfastroom. Intimate and nice in oldfashioned furnishing and a warm feeling to it. The champagnebar wasn't that exciting, but bring your cold refreshment to the lounge and relax by the fireplace. The rooms are furnished in different styles. My travel companion got a Business room in stars and blu(e) stripes and my room was light with blue stripes. Very good bed and a nice sitting area. In my room the Nespressomachine was missing. Bathroom was ok with bathtub and shower but well worne. Cleanliness is probably not the main focus. Daily household is sufficient, but the rooms, and probably the hotel in all, needs a more frequent maincleaning and its clear signs of wearing here and there. Service was brilliant during our stay. Especially our breakfast friend is worth mentioning. A big smile, a litle joke and allways a burning hot cappucino at the ready. Breakfast was infact a very nice start of the day. Not a big buffet but with warm service and personalised as you like it. Only minus is the french bread. Value? As a northern european I'm used to larger rooms and more modern comfort. The old building and oldfashioned interiour is lovely, but maybe not worth $400 for a businessroom, especially when you are not getting the business features. Will I stay here again? Absolutely, and especially if the price is between $200 - $300

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel - here on business but good otherwise as well”
Reviews.Author: Kanaschwiiz
Reviews.Content: Gem of a hotel - stayed only one night for work but very nice. Small (but not too small - 45 rooms) and elegantly appointed. Adoreable little lift. Lots of weird angles in this wedge-shaped building. Bedding was really good. Young men at the desk also very good. Only problem: poor shower pressure/head but there was a hand-held unit as well which was fine. Appreciate also the single temperature control on the water. View mediocre (but I had things closed and at least windows could open); mediocre soaps. Could improve climate control. Breakfast (27 Euros) expensive/overpriced but that's Paris/Europe/Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “extremely arrogant booking manager.recommend ambassador hotel”
Reviews.Author: sasemployee
Reviews.Content: tried to book,NEVER received confirmation,but had to pay for not staying.contacted manager,was impossible to help us.very arrogant.stayed at ambassador where they actually sent confirmation,and was very nice staff and great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mazzy0406
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. My boyfriend and I booked a trip away for new year and were not disappointed! Our room was very clean, small but cosy! The beds are exceptionally comfortable! The staff were very friendly and helpful! In a great location if want to stay near eiffel tower and about 20 mins walk into champs elysees!The only negative about the hotel was when i got home i came to find that the hotel charged my card twice for hotel payment, when i gave my card over desk on arrival! which i was unaware of till i got home. They apologised and refunded the money. Breakfast in hotel is good.I would definitely stay there again, very cosy hotel.I recommend this hotel for a short break away! You will not be disappointed!:)

Reviews.Title: “I'm looking forward to my next stay”
Reviews.Author: AyseA
Reviews.Content: The hotel and its service were better than our expactations. Since it's a small hotel; therefore, we got personal attention from the cheese that we want for breakfast to beautiful welcome letter accompanied with berries. Our room had lot of light. Moreover, that's the only place other than our own house, we had the most comfortable bed and cleanest sheets. We are looking forward to our next stay at Radisson Le Dokhan.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Carolina2929
Reviews.Content: I came to Paris for my honeymoon. I've discovered this charming hotel on internet, and I'm so glad I did it ! Wonderful room, so romantic ! The staff looked after us so well, everybody have been so nice ! The champagne bar is unique, and the breakfast was excellent. To conclude, our time spent there was a blast, I can only recommend you the very cosy and charming Parisian hotel :-)

Reviews.Title: “Room already occupied by Mr & Mrs Cockroach”
Reviews.Author: Shabsee
Reviews.Content: We came to Paris to see Grizzly Bear play and stayed at the hotel for one night. We arrived at 2pm and were given a room on the 5th floor. Was pretty small for the price paid, but then old Paris buildings are usually pretty small. We had a nap before setting out. At 5pm I awoke and went to use the bathroom. Unfortunately Mr & Mrs Cockroach had forgotten to lock the door and were having a whale of a time chasing each other round the top of the toliet pan. Thank god it wasn't the middle of the night and I was half asleep! We complained to the staff and were transferred to the Ming Suite on the top floor. Was a bigger room with a cracking view of the Eiffel Tower. We made sure to keep the bathroom light on all night though, to stop our friends from the 5th floor telling their mates where we were! We also avoided the breakfast in the morning! Upon checkout a different desk clerk asked us if we were happy. We informed him of the situation and was told the situation was being looked at. No apology though, and quite a rude manner, hence this write-up. Also we decided not to leave our bags in reception whilst we explored the city, just in case our new friends wanted to come home with us. So in a roach shell.. I'd say watch out for the roaches- not really what you'd expect at the prices they charge!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was not at all what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: Norma_Atlanta_Ga
Reviews.Content: I had been planning our trip for many months because we were celebrating a special anniversary. Paris was our last stop on a long holiday and I wanted our stay in Paris to be special. I searched many hotels and thought the Radisson would be perfect. I was soooo wrong. The hotel is a three star at best., certainly not a four star as billed. The elevator can barely hold two people, let alone a suitcase. The public areas were very cramped. Because it was our anniversary, we were supposedly upgraded. The room was miniscule with no room for luggage. There was barely room to walk around the bed. The bathroon was very average at best. The Raddison was described as being just off of the Arc De Triumphe. Rue Laurison is only a couple of blocks from the Arch, that's true. What you are not told is that the hotel is many, many, many blocks down the street, completely at the opposite end, away from the Arch. It was absolutely not the convenient location that we expected. The Chanpagne bar was closed. Granted it was August and many things are closed during that month. The breakfast area and bar/lounge area are one and the same and very small. We did not eat breakfast there. The cost was well over $30.00 per person. The best thing I can say about the hotel is that the desk clerk was very nice. You can do much better staying at another hotel. I do not recommend the Radisson, Trocadero at all.

Reviews.Title: “Over and above service, particularly after passport stolen at airport”
Reviews.Author: ahptraveler049
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this wonderful, distinctive hotel a few times and each time the stay has been enjoyable. What sent this hotel to the top of my list, though, was a stay in 2007. After taxing away from the hotel with luggage and friends, my passport was stolen at the CdG ticket counter. It was the Friday of Labor Day weekend. After talking with the Embassy, I learned that I would need a police report from the police at the airport, and other documentation. However, the airport pollice refused to file a report, saying I was not a French citizen and I was not their concern. The rest of my party flew back to the States, and I was left with no passport, no olice report, and no cell phone. In desperation, I returned to the hotel. The manager was AMAZING. She had her staff go out and sign for a rental cell phone for me, for the duration of my stay (I was not able to leave the country until the following Wednesday). She walked me to the Dokhans' local police station and convinced the officer there to complete a police report so that I could start the process on an emergency passport. They rebooked me into the hotel at a discounted rate. I will never forget how they took me under their wing!

Reviews.Title: “A truly great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sacul
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Radisson Dokhan's from July 20th to 23rd. We travel a lot and rely on trip advisor and it certainly did not let us down. This hotel is a real gem. Yes it is small from the rooms to the elevator but it is big in service and charm. We received a complementary upgrade to a larger room and found it to be adequate, well maintained and clean. Breakfast is served in a relaxed room with no more than 12 tables. we only ever saw one other couple in the room. Service was first class and the breakfast delicious...try to get a package that includes breakfast as it is not cheap otherwise. Everything is so freshand good tasting, especially the croissants! The location is perfect as others have attested to and finding a good restaurant in the area will not pose a problem. Every staff member we came in contact with went out of their way to make sure that we were happy. Even the manager heped us connect to the free internet connection when we experienced problems. You could probably find a better hotel in Paris if you looked very hard but this one has everything that you will need at what I would consider excellent value. Book with confidence, you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - want to know your going to get a nice hotel - book this one!!”
Reviews.Author: dazzathestag
Reviews.Content: I took my wife for a 4 day break to Paris. I like to know that i wont get any nasty suprises with the hotel and although this one isnt cheap it didnt dissapoint. Room was ready early and we got a free upgrade. The rooms are not huge and the upgrade was supposed to be bigger, but it was very clean, nicely decorated in period style and very comfortable. You will see from the picture that the toilet was tiny - in fact I could shut the door when on the throne! I am 6' 4" though. Mini bar in room. Although no formal restaurant, room service was available 24/7 and the breakfast was a la carte and very nice. Staff were great. I guess there were only around 40 rooms and we hardly saw anyone, perhaps 6 others at breakfast when it was busy ! It was great. Position too was fantastic, 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower and the Arch de Triumphe. Would definately go back. PS if you dont like stairs and scared of tiny lifts then this isnt for you - the lift felt like a coffin, it said it would take 4 people but boy you would have to know them well !

Reviews.Title: “Charming and chic”
Reviews.Author: MissTrump
Reviews.Content: The pictures look nice, but seeing it in person ... I was really impressed. All the staff is very charming, professional and polite and all speak very good english (as opposed to my pretty poor french). The feel of the place is like staying in somebody's very lovely and beautifully furnished townhouse. The room was chaming and romantic but, seriously small - my advice is to upgrade, I'm assuming it's probably worth it. It's fine for a weekend though. The tiny balcony was a lovely touch. Bathroom - again very small - I'm quite petite but struggled a bit with a lack of space. Location is good with 3 stations within 3-5 mins walk. Also, the area didn't feel touristy, we really enjoyed Friday evening in one of nearby cafes surrounded by locals, but it is fairly quiet during the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “true boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMCPortugal
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. The rooms are a bit small but very confortable. Attention is given to details. The staff is very polite and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: crazyhawtrey
Reviews.Content: This was the best Birthday treat ever, the hotel was great room a little on the small side but overall great stay and the champagne bar was also different but cool. Stayed with the most nicest person ever!

Reviews.Title: “hotel with a flair like a french chanson”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamMec
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel with flair. I loved the ambiance, the location, the staff, the rooms, the decorations and not least the champagne bar (stay there at cocktail hour or when returning at the hotel late evenings) What a beautiful warm and personal hotel this is. Petit, but cozy like a french chanson. Will go again. Defenitly a yes for everybody who likes it traditional and 5* warm personal...

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel and staff that couldn't care less”
Reviews.Author: admiral64
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sofitel for a romantic 3 night break for my husband's birthday, based on a recommendation and previous experience at other Sofitels in Marseille and Paris. On arrival at around 3pm Friday afternoon, my request for a quiet room on a high floor had been met and we were directed to a charming room on the 5th floor with a small balcony. As my family is French I started by speaking French, but the hotel staff insisted on speaking English, presumably because my married name was English. This was no problem the day we arrived..... On Friday night, we went to the champagne bar in the hotel for an aperitif before going out to dinner. The hotel offers a tasting experience where you are offered small glasses of different champagnes with accompanying hors d'ouevres. The menu states that this is not available on Fridays; however, a "proper" French couple who arrived 20 minutes after us were offered it without asking. The next morning, we went out to see Paris at about 9am. When we returned at 3pm, our room still had not been made up, despite the fact that the housekeeping trolley had been on our floor when we left 6 hours before.
