There was no-one around so I made the bed and we settled down for an afternoon nap. Despite the Do Not Disturb notice, the maid entered the room and encountered us naked, much to my (very British!) husband's chagrin. My husband dressed and went down to Reception to make sure there was no repetition, and to ask for some fresh towels so we could shower before dinner. He was assured this was a one off and would not happen again. Sunday, we went out about the same time and got back to the hotel at 3.30pm. Again, our room had not been made up. I made the bed and changed the towels from the trolley on the floor while my husband went back down to Reception to ensure we would not get disturbed; 15 minutes later, the maid walked straight into our room again. At this point, I called and asked to speak to a manager. I spoke to a lady who said she was the restaurant manager and offered us a free breakfast for the inconvenience of having to clean and make up our own room for the weekend. I pointed out that we do not eat breakfast and what I wanted was a reduction in our rate, commensurate with what they would have paid the maid for actually cleaning and doing up the room each day, rather than waiting until the Do Not Disturb notice went up and then walking in, almost guaranteeing she wouldn't have to do anything. This lady promised to refer this to a manager the next morning as she had no authority. At check out, the day manager took my card for the bar bill and clearly had no idea that there had been any problem. I delcined to explain as we were due to catch a Eurostar back to London, but I wrote to the manager on our return setting out the problems and asking for his comment. Six weeks later, I have received neither acknowledgement nor response and have given up waiting. I am very surprised to be treated like this by a Sofitel, which is normally a great brand. In summary, if you really want the Paris tradition and romance, together with world class service and food, stay at Le Crillon, which is the best hotel in the world and where we usually stay. I have learned my lesson about being a tourist in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “silver wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: ad803
Reviews.Content: just returned after spending 3 nights for our silver wedding anniversary. Booked it after reading the reviews posted on this site. The hotel is excellently located between the Arch de Triumph and the Eiffel Tower and the whole time there we were able to walk everywhere. I think the only locality we didn't manage was the Sacre Coeur, need to leave somthing for next time. We used the Air France bus from CDG airport, 22 euros return, to the Arc de Triumph and walked 10 minutes up Ave Kleber turning right after the Hotel Baltimore. No bother at all, runs every half hour and takes approximately 40 minutes. We occupied a Superior room, which was not cramped, the bed, as has been previously mentioned is very soft, a little soft for me, but that is a personal preference. The room was very quiet, the street the hotel is located on is in the heart of a busy district but set on a quiet road so little or no noise. The staff were extremely polite and friendly and able to answer questions knowlwdgeably. We made the decision after reading reveiws, not to partake of the breakfast, currently it is 28 euros, which l feel is over priced. We always ate out at any bistro or street market we could find, very reasonably and fresh. Overall loved the hotel, would ceratinly return there. Only one failing, could do with introducung coffee/tea making facility in room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel shame about the drama queen!”
Reviews.Author: derxa
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week in Paris and this hotel was great in many ways. A lovely location and comfortable bedroom/bathroom. However our experience of breakfast was very bizarre bordering on comical. The lady who served us breakfast on some mornings clearly did not enjoy serving tables. I made the error of asking for a cooked breakfast one day and she made it and served a very strange version of scrambled eggs. I know the French do not eat eggs for breakfast but it was on the menu. she gave my husband and I one little pot of coffee between us. She kept crashing and banging everywhere until one guest asked if she wanted help. She replied very sarcastically that she didn't understand. This farce continued until we could not keep a straight face and I think she realised her behaviour was out of order. At the end of the week she was replaced by a pleasant young man who seemed not to mind serving tables- like most French waiters who see it as a profession not a menial task. We did not complain because it was all a bit petty.

Reviews.Title: “Chic in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ce04dje
Reviews.Content: For our 20th wedding anniversary we booked a weekend break in Paris, and after extensive searching for an hotel, decided on this hotel. We were not disappointed. The location is great - about half way between the Eifel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe. The hotel itself is very small - perhaps about 40 rooms in total. This is not a modern business hotel - it is very quaint, and has a wonderful charm and ambience. It was like stepping back 50 years in terms of the character of the hotel - but this worked brilliantly. There isn't really anything I could fault about the hotel. Our room was nicely decorated, and of a good size, and with a good sized bathroom. The hotel itself is situated off a main road, so was very quiet. In fact the hotel seemed to be located in a very affluent area which was a mixture of residential, and commercial properties. We found a nice Italian restaurant over the road from the entrance to the hotel, called Ozio, and would recommend this to anyone wishing a nice meal not too far from the hotel. (There were lots of other places to eat nearby also). Overall, we found this to be a great hotel. Couldn't fault it in any way, and would definately recommend this to others, and would probably stay here again if we went back to Paris for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Best part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: fazbert
Reviews.Content: We booked and paid in advance and were offered an upgrade to a deluxe room which was well worth it. The locale was very civilized, yet only a walk to Eiffel Tower. Breakfast was extortianate and we passed on it. Room was very nicely maintained with an excellent view. An expensive but well worth it experience. Front desk was always cooperative and friendly. They lend out lap tops if you need a computer.

Reviews.Title: “A great first wedding aniversary”
Reviews.Author: BeatleBurgos
Reviews.Content: To celebrate our first weddind aniversary we decided to go to Paris and the election of the hotel was my husband´s decission. I only want to say that our weekend there was absolutely fantastic. The hotel is beautiful, the personal very charming, the room was perfect, the bed... the best one I´ve ever slept in. Although we were not very much time in the room, we could rest and sleep perfectly because it all was very quiet. I think it is the best option to spend a weekend in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: galwaygirl78
Reviews.Content: we are just back from a perfect weekend in this gorgeous hotel. if you like staying in small boutique hotels, with attention to detail and excellent service this is the place for you. we booked directly on the hotels website, got a really good B&B rate and got upgraded on arrival. Its in a lovely quiet neighbourhood, with 2 metro stops in close proximity. A tip for anyone visiting Paris, go see the moulin rouge show, its really worth the extortinate prices!!

Reviews.Title: “romance extravaganza”
Reviews.Author: gargouille1970
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, very nice people and friendly service. Exceptional rooms, small but cosy. Great champagnebar. Nice Picasso and Matisse paintings in the foyer with burning fireplace. The elevator is all covered with and old Louis Vuitton trunk. Great place to stay for couples looking for a romantic stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “They Have No Problem Bumping People”
Reviews.Author: imnaffedoff
Reviews.Content: I Would advise anyone NOT to book a room in this hotel. My Girlfriend and I were looking forward to a really speciall stay in Paris and paid a large amount to spend 4 nights in this hotel. The rooms were booked well in advance and as I was booking them I was informed SEVERAL TIMES that there was a 'no cancellation' policy that would begin 3 weeks before we arrived and that I would have to pay even if we changed our mind 3 weeks in advance. SADLY this policy was totally neglected by the hotel itself who phoned me 5 DAYS before we were due to turn up to tell me we couldnt actually stay there after all. There had been a problem with their electronic reservations system (yeah right) when the room had been confirmed by email 3 weeks earlier. IN REALITY, someone important probably wanted to stay there, the whole hotel was full, and the English Speakers got bumped (typical Parisian attitude). BE VERY WARY if you book here, and make ALTERNATIVE ARRANGEMENTS, as this hotel is liable to cancel your room at the last minute. Disgusting Behaviour

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel.. a liitle gem!!”
Reviews.Author: BANKSIE35
Reviews.Content: This hotel has left us with very fond memories of Paris. The staff were really friendly and while the room was very small it was really cosy and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in. The champagne bar downstairs was a delight though it was expensive. A short stroll took us to the Trocadero where there are lots of restaurants and cafes. A short stroll in the opposite directon led us to the Arc de Triomphe. I can understand that this hotel may be seen as a little on the sxpensive side but if you are looking for something a little different, quiet and romantic, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Romance and Parisian ambiance in a quiet area of town”
Reviews.Author: better_be_good
Reviews.Content: Being my first visit to Paris, I wanted to stay somewhere that captured the essence and character of the city. This hit the spot dead-on. My husband and I always lean toward more boutique style hotels for this exact reason. Immediately upon entering the hotel, we were completely smitten. Floor to ceiling silk drapes dressed the windows, a candle-lit lounge and Frank Sinatra playing in the background. Quaint, intimate and romantic, this hotel seems to have done it right. Location: Being in more of a residential area, I liked that it was somewhat out of the crowded tourist zones, but still very close to the main attractions. L'Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees are a mere 5 minute cab drive. Overall, our favorite thing to do each evening was to walk the three blocks down to Trocadero Square and eat at one of the many cafe's enjoying the night time view of the Eiffel Tower. Dining: Continental breakfast (juice, coffee, croissants, muffins and yogurt) was included each morning with our room and made for a great start to the day. While you can enjoy light snacks in the afternoon, there really isn't an official restaurant on the premise. We didn't see this as a problem as part of the fun was enjoying the local cafes. Each evening we opted for a suggestion from the hotel manager/concierge and were never let down. Our first night was spent at the Museum Cafe (a short three block walk). While we were pre-advised of the food being somewhat average, the view at this restaurant was to die for. We were not let down. With such a spectacular location, this really was one of the highlights of our trip. Room: Although somewhat small (as others have mentioned), the room was extremely charming with a generous sized bathroom. Very comfortable bed with local parisian chocolates placed nightly on our pillows. My only complaint would have been for the air condition to have worked a little better. Tip: We booked the room as a bed and breakfast package through an online website and paid about half of the usual rack rate. Coming from London, we took the Eurostar train direct to Paris. This was half the fun and not nearly as much trouble as the airports. Overall: If you're looking for swimming pools, spa, fitness and on-site restaurants I would suggest staying elsewhere. If you're looking for romance and charming ambiance in a more quiet area of town, this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A charming and relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariasilvestre
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Paris to celebrate our wedding anniversary and stayed 3 days at this Hotel. It's an island of peace: starting the day with light classical music at the breakfast (to be served very late in the morning at client's wishes!)and ending late night with soft jazz or old romantic songs, was truly relaxing. The staff also is very kind. So, if you want a "normal" Hotel, full of activity, people, breakfast buffett etc. go elsewhere. But if you appreciate charm, class and peace this is the right Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charmed by Sofitel Trocadero's atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: jogee9
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most relaxing hotel locations that we've visited so far. The intimate ambiance of this small hotel was just what we were looking for in the City of Lights. The surrounding neighborhood is quiet but just close enough to the tourist trail. The Eiffel Tower & Arc de Triomphe are nearby as well as multiple, conveniently located Metro stations. The attentive staff at this hotel is a major asset. The manager, Madame Marie, personally greets guests upon their arrival and she is always certain to stop by your breakfast table to chat. The breakfast menu, included in our package, was so delicious & hearty that we didn't have to waste our time stopping for lunch. Each evening we were welcomed back after a long day to find fresh, crisp white sheets & Lenotre chocolates in the room. Ours, #505, was a cozy room with a canopy over an extremely comfortable bed, balcony which overlooked the local rooftops, marble bathroom with a powerful shower, and laptop computer (upon request). Overall, this hotel gets high marks for making our ten day stay a pleasant & memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Tasteful, elegant and superb service”
Reviews.Author: happyweekenders
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Paris for a romantic weekend and was delighted with this hotel. The staff were so attentive and the manageress even welcomed us personally when we arrived. We had a superb room (unfortunately with not much view which we did not expect anyway). The room was clean, big enough, huge comfortable bed and lovely bathroom with a large tub, big sink area which my husband had and an even better area with a large shelf and big mirror for me to do my make up etc without getting into each others way. The only down side to the room was the size of the toilet which was in a room off the bathroom (well I say room but really it was a cupboard). If you closed the door it was bordering on being claustraphobic. The concierge was great, ordering taxis for us each evening, taking an interest into where we were going and we were not even charged for the taxi calls. Breakfast was enough, lots of choice and a big plus for us - breakfast was served until lunchtime. Giving time for a lovely lie in. If its one thing I hate about hotels, its having to get up and ready before 9am. We even had breakfast served in our bedroom the first morning at no extra cost. The hotel is sited very conveniently for the metro and we even walked back to the hotel after two evenings out. One from Jules Verne at the Eiffel Tower and the other from The Lido. An enjoyable visit and a hotel we would definitely return to.

Reviews.Title: “The most clueless hotel I have stayed in for a while!!”
Reviews.Author: TommyKnoxville
Reviews.Content: Well, (Just to give you an idea of the writer, I'm 24, sociable, lively person, just like most other 24 year olds) Firstly, upon arrival we were given the incorrect room when I’d thought I’d paid for a deluxe, we got superior, the worst start. The room was nicely decorated in 1980! Approximately, it needs a refurb desperately (chipped paint on doors etc). The rooms are tiny! Tiny! Notably with a sick stain on the wall and carpet outside of our room (502), which we did ask them to clean, but to no avail. I’m surprised the staff didn’t just say well monsieur we are in Paris, because that’s what their excuse is for everything from the size of the rooms to trying to charge 27 EUROS for a cereal! Crazy! This hotel is far from touch in fact so far out of touch its in orbit. The concierge was asked to direct my girlfriend and I to a lively section of Paris. Instead we were routed to nowhere following a map and road names so we weren’t wrong, the concierge sent both of us on a French wild goose trip! Well it was sorted eventually ending up in Buddha Bar a very cool place just off the Place de Concorde, but with sore feet!! Other points noted were a dirty bathroom, and so much dust behind the bed it must have been gathering for years! Lovely touch (dust being made up of 90% human skin cells!). When checking out I commented on the fact that I couldn't care less if I was Paris, Dubai, London or New York I expect the same standards when paying nearly 400 GBP for a room, we are after all in an international city, although they would like to think they were a class above. WOULD NOT STAY AGAIN, I think I've made that clear! Happy travelling to all. Hope this has been useful to you. Best of luck!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Parisian!”
Reviews.Author: AmericanwomanSthlm
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel with all the French charm you could wish for. Both the building and the interior is truly lovely. Service is impeccable and probably the most romantic hotel I've ever stayed at. The hotel is clean and extravagantly furnished with a tasteful combination of modern and classic details. The location is also great, close to both sightseeing and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TomDrach1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trocadero Dokhan for the last night of our Honeymoon - it is a beautiful hotel. Very conveniently located, just a few blocks from the metro stop, with plenty of good resteraunts in the area. The Concierge was so helpful in helping is locate our lost camera (we had left it in a resteraunt in Munich!) - and were very friendly and helpful whenever we had questions. The room was a bit small, but its very elegantly decorated, and well stocked. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would most definitely return!

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Blu Le Dokhan's Hotel, Paris Trocadero
HotelInfo.Address: 117 rue Lauriston, 75116 Paris, France (Formerly Radisson SAS)
